content: Good morning Rohan 🌞 just a quick reminder—your Q3 Kick-Off call is set for 10:00 today. Neel will lead, and everyone will be on. I’ll send the dial-in shortly.
Thanks Ruby, I’ll be ready by 10.
Morning all, let’s kick off right on time. Today we’ll frame Q3 around your Longevity Decathlon goals and align execution with the keto experiment as our first initiative. 🚀
Good framing Neel. Clear direction—let’s run with it.
Perfect. I’ll circulate the Q3 execution notes right after this call so you have everything consolidated in one place.
👍 Appreciate the quick follow-through.
Rohan, noticed your Garmin flagged low step count today—understand it’s Sunday. Even a 20-min walk will help circulation and offset the keto stiffness you mentioned last week.
Thanks Rachel, I’ll squeeze in a short walk before dinner.
Morning! Quick heads-up—lab courier coming at 09:00 tomorrow for your scheduled quarterly blood draw. Sarah is aware.
Noted. Thanks for keeping it tight Ruby.

I spoke with Javier today—he’s finding keto recipes straightforward and says sourcing hasn’t been an issue. He also noted your energy looks steadier throughout the day 💡. Valuable ecosystem data point.
That’s great to hear. I do feel less of a 3pm dip.
Rohan—small miss on my side 🙈. Forgot to include the Zoom link for tomorrow’s nutrition check-in. Just sent it over now.
No worries Ruby, I saw it. All good 👍
Courier is at the door for your labs. Shouldn’t take more than 10 mins.
Done. Smooth as always.
Rohan, quick mid-experiment snapshot 📊: Week 2 of keto shows GKI steady in therapeutic range. Focus scores averaged 4.5—baseline was 3. Strong positive signal supporting your hypothesis.
That’s encouraging. Thanks Advik, data matches how I’m feeling.

Rohan, your HRV stability—even with travel and training load—shows your autonomic system is more resilient. This lowers risk of a POTS/long COVID flare. We’ll continue quarterly monitoring, but this is excellent progress.
That’s reassuring Warren 🙏. Appreciate the proactive note.
Morning Rohan—Rachel suggests a lighter stretch set today instead of full mobility. She’ll send you a short video clip.
Perfect. 10 mins is all I can fit today anyway.
Question for the team—assuming this focus boost holds, is the long-term play staying keto, or is this about building metabolic flexibility to switch fuels efficiently?

Great q. Keto isn’t a forever plan—it’s a tool. Long-term, we’re aiming for metabolic flexibility: smoothly shifting between carbs and fats. This preserves focus benefits while allowing dietary variety.
Exactly. Think of this as building the ‘muscle’ of fuel switching. We’ll test it during carb reintroduction next week using your CGM response.
Makes sense—feels like a strategic skill for the body.
Merry Christmas 🎄 Hope you’re enjoying family time. Just a reminder—nutrition call tomorrow is shifted to 16:00 at your request.
Thanks Ruby, noted. Keeping today light.
Quick check-in—holiday dinners can mean longer sitting. Try standing every 45 mins to ease circulation 👍
Will do. Easy enough trick.
Rohan, as we approach the end of keto Sunday, I’ve sent you + Javier the Carb Re-introduction Protocol. We’ll add back specific low-glycemic carbs and monitor via CGM.
Got it Carla, thanks for the foresight.
Also—Q3 kickoff notes and actions are in your inbox. Let me know if you’d like me to set interim milestones with Sarah for calendar tracking.
Please go ahead, Ruby. Milestones will keep me honest.
Noting for closure: GKI still consistent at optimal range this morning. Data set looks clean for end-of-experiment analysis Sunday.
Excellent. Looking forward to full review.
Reminder: tomorrow’s call at 09:00 will be short (15 mins). Just to formally close keto experiment and align on reintroduction.
Got it, thanks Ruby. Good to keep it crisp.
Final note—please keep hydration high tonight and tomorrow as we shift. Electrolytes will help smooth transition.
Noted Carla. I’ll top up electrolytes. Appreciate everyone’s support this round 🙏
